title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black paper.
ingredients: 200g (7 oz) Spaghetti ,100g (3.5 oz) Pancetta or Bacon (cut into small pieces) ,2 large Eggs ,50g (1.7 oz) Parmesan Cheese (grated) ,1 clove Garlic (optional) ,Salt (to taste) ,Black Pepper (freshly ground)1 tbsp Olive Oil
cookinginstructions: Boil spaghetti in salted water until al dente
then drain (reserve ½ cup pasta water).
In a bowl, whisk eggs, grated Parmesan, salt, and black pepper.
In a pan, cook pancetta (or bacon) until crispy, then add garlic (optional) for flavor.
Remove from heat, add drained pasta, and toss quickly.
Pour in the egg mixture, stirring continuously to create a creamy sauce (add reserved pasta water if needed).
Serve hot, garnished with extra Parmesan and black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chiken  (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
ingredients: Boneless chicken, plain yogurt, lemon juice, garam masala, ground cumin, ground coriander, paprika, turmeric powder, salt, ginger-garlic paste, oil, butter, onion, garlic, ginger, crushed tomatoes, heavy cream or coconut milk, sugar (optional), and fresh cilantro
cookinginstructions: Mix yogurt, lemon juice, spices, salt, and ginger-garlic paste, then marinate chicken for at least 30 minutes (preferably overnight).
Grill, pan-fry, or bake the marinated chicken until cooked and slightly charred.
In a pan, heat butter/oil and sauté onions until golden brown.
Add garlic, ginger, and spices, cooking until fragrant.
Pour in crushed tomatoes and simmer until thickened.
Add heavy cream/coconut milk and cooked chicken, then simmer for 5–10 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro, alongside rice or naan.
